work.name: Oracle (Cerner)
work.summary:
Responsible for the planning, coordinating, executing, running go-lives of technical projects for three major Oracle Cerner hosted clients in Australia. Queensland health (13k+ CCU), Alfred Health (2.5k CCU), and Western Health (1.8k CCU).

Projects varied from technically supporting major consulting projects with the introduction of new solutions/workflows, tech currency upgrades (Linux, Citrix, Windows, downtime solutions), BAU projects (Millennium release upgrades, Disaster Recovery testing, domain refreshes).

Projects where planned and tracked via Jiras. Daily scrums were held across clients, with remote resources located in Australia and India.

I also ensured lessons learned were being tracked, documented, and shared amongs the region or globally.

work.name: Oracle (Cerner)
work.summary:
I am responsible for developing and managing the overall client technical project roadmap, including the delivery of upgrades and go-live events, as well as serving as the technical liaison between Cerner and the client.

The main project I delivered was a data centre migration (RHO flip) project that moved Western Health Millennium solutions from HTS to Cerner data center. This was the first RHO flip from HTS, and this included the first CAMM images migration to the cloud (CAMM7). In addition to those unknown challenges from being first in country, the project was delivered 100% remotely from Australia, India, the US, and during the pandemic lockdowns.

I am also looking at standardising our deliverables by enhancing our internal documentation, defining workplan / project plans, and promoting internal tools to that effect (JiraHelper, ACME, Github, Config as Code, Chef).

Working with live environments and the largest Cerner client outside of the US made me realize the need for strong monitoring tools. I have been adopting and promoting Zabbix and Splunk internally ensuring server monitoring was configured as part of project (NAT, Firewall etc.) and creating reports (Train domains status).

work.name: Oracle (Cerner)
work.summary: I have successfully delivered many projects, including mergers, Phase X RDDS projects, and roll outs. My responsibilities were to design and oversee the execution of domain, issue, and change management strategies; proactively identify and mitigate integration risks at both the project and program level; and manage complex client relationships across multiple stakeholders to guarantee objectives are delivered to ensure optimal clinical adoption.

work.name: Oracle (Cerner)
work.summary:
I successfully delivered many projects. The most recent one was Oncology (First of Type), SurgiNet Anesthesia and Critical Care at Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust!
I lately worked on Merger along with a Medication, Clinical documentation and EDSE phase project.

Side projects:
  • I created an Excel tool in order to graphically display programme/project domain strategies
  • Improving the Data Quality by enhancing our internal tool

work.name: Oracle (Cerner)
work.summary:
As a Delivery Consultant (DC), I am responsible for the Design, Implementation, Audit and Troubleshooting of the Patient Registration Solution (ERM). I play a critical role in the delivery of Cerner’s solutions to clients. My key function is to understand and carry out analysis of the Cerner solution workflow and follow this process to system build and testing.

In addition:
  • Creative Troubleshooter (ERM, ESM, CORE, FSI, CDS, EKM rules)
  • CCL scripting (Exporting domain's information reduced from 2h to 2 minutes (96% improvement), Cleanup script running on 150,000 records).

work.name: ST Microelectronics
work.summary: I delivered a solution improving management team efficiency in the approval handling of multiple e-forms. I planned the project, interviewed internal customers, reported my weekly progress and improved my knowledge on J2EE and two frameworks (Struts 2; Hibernate).

work.name: Orange
work.summary: I always reached and often exceeded my monthly sales goals.

work.name: Continental Automotive Systems
work.summary: I delivered two analyses and a comparison on the two existing information systems, in order to highlight major differences for the next step of the project. I used UML diagrams (Use Case diagram; Class diagram; Sequence diagram; Communication diagram). During my internship I planned and organized the project and reported to a German project manager through weekly reporting and fortnightly conference calls.

work.name: IT Tallaght
work.summary: I took over an ongoing project and was the main interlocutor for the customer. I delivered an educational software suite which makes understand implementation basics in 4 programming languages to students (flowcharts; Turing machine; pseudo-code; assembly language).
